alert.note: Alert for Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Dutchess County through 230 PM EDT... At 153 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gardnertown, or over Newburgh, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beacon, Fishkill, Beacon Hills, Dutchess Junction, Chelsea, Castle Point, Wiccopee, Shenandoah, Brinckerhoff, Brockway, Groveville and Glenham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
